parts the first part is transfer learning now transfer learning involves
taking a pre trained model so this is a neural network just representation of a
neural network a pre trained model consists of the model code that describes the algorithm that it's using
and the techniques that it's applying as well as the parameters that have been
learned potentially on millions of images so transfer learning works by
taking this pre trained model taking a copy of it I'll cut off the last layers those are
the layers that were specific to the problem that was learned and I'm going to keep all of the rest of the the model
in place and that's going to be the feature extraction that I'm going to utilize I'm then going to create my own
outputs based on the problem that I'm working on so in this case these are going to be the classes that I want the
model to learn so different types of fruit so it could be the tomatoes grapes etc I'm going to create one or more
hidden layers between my output layer and the pre-trained model and now all I have to learn is the relationships for
those last layers now this means that the amount of data I now need to do this
training is much smaller I can get by with a couple of you hundred examples
now but using this technique I've saved myself thousands of hours and dollars
and it's allowing me to stand on the shoulders of much more capable machine learning practitioners now I still need
